pullRequest.body:
Show that the absolute polar is weak*-closed and absolutely convex.

Via `closedAbsConvexHull_min` this establishes the easy direction of the Bipolar Theorem #20843

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Oops - forgot to remove the `WIP` label.
The import increase is unacceptably large. Can you try to find a better place with `#find_home`? Probably something in `Analysis.Normed` is the way to go, but I'm not certain.

> The import increase is unacceptably large. Can you try to find a better place with `#find_home`? Probably something in `Analysis.Normed` is the way to go, but I'm not certain.

`#find_home LinearMap.polar_AbsConvex` and `#find_home! LinearMap.polar_AbsConvex` both say `[Mathlib.Analysis.LocallyConvex.Polar]`.

(N.B. I haven't used `#find_home` before, so perhaps I'm doing something wrong?)
I think that's because in your branch you've edited the `Polar` file to have the necessary imports already.

> I think that's because in your branch you've edited the `Polar` file to have the necessary imports already.

I'm not really getting how this is supposed to work. I removed `LinearMap.polar_AbsConvex` from `Mathlib/Analysis/LocallyConvex/Polar.lean`  and ran `lake build`. Then I created `Mathlib/mwe.lean` as:

```
import Mathlib

variable {𝕜 E F : Type*}

section NormedAlgebra

variable [NormedField 𝕜] [NormedSpace ℝ 𝕜] [AddCommMonoid E] [AddCommMonoid F]
variable [Module 𝕜 E] [Module 𝕜 F]

variable {B : E →ₗ[𝕜] F →ₗ[𝕜] 𝕜} (s : Set E)

variable [Module ℝ F] [IsScalarTower ℝ 𝕜 F] [IsScalarTower ℝ 𝕜 𝕜]

namespace LinearMap

theorem polar_AbsConvex : AbsConvex 𝕜 (B.polar s) := by
  rw [polar_eq_biInter_preimage]
  exact AbsConvex.iInter₂ fun i hi =>
    ⟨Balanced.mulActionHom_preimage (E := F) (balanced_closedBall_zero (E := 𝕜) (r := (1 : ℝ)))
      (𝕜 := 𝕜) (B i), Convex.linear_preimage (convex_closedBall _ _) (B i)⟩

#find_home! polar_AbsConvex

end LinearMap
```

But `#find_home! polar_AbsConvex` just says `[Mathlib]`?
I had another go, copying the lemma into `Mathlib.lean` itself and renaming it. Now `#find_home` says `[Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Module.Dual]`, so I guess that's our answer?

Weirdly `Analysis.LocallyConvex.Polar` is still showing a change?

```
| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.LocallyConvex.Polar | 1308 | 1368 | +60 (+4.59%) |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Module.Dual | 1764 | 1768 | +4 (+0.23%) |
```
I don't understand what's happening here?

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22264~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22352~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@j-loreaux the `large-import` label has been removed from the PR now, so please are you able to take another look?
Might as well generalize the `IsLinearMap` version while you're at it.
Done.

I *think* this is the correct notation.
```suggestion
    (f : E →[𝕜] F) : Balanced 𝕜 (f ⁻¹' s) := fun a ha x ⟨y,⟨hy₁,hy₂⟩⟩ => by
```

```suggestion
theorem polar_isClosed (s : Set E) : IsClosed (X := WeakBilin B.flip) (B.polar s) := by
```

```suggestion
theorem polar_eq_biInter_preimage (s : Set E) :
    B.polar s = ⋂ x ∈ s, ((B x) ⁻¹' Metric.closedBall (0 : 𝕜) 1) := by aesop
```
Why don't you make this a `proof_wanted`?
I hadn't come across `proof_wanted` before: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/113488-general/topic/.60proof_wanted.60
I don't understand why this is an `example`.

```suggestion
    (f : E →[𝕜] F) : Balanced 𝕜 (f ⁻¹' s) := fun a ha x ⟨y,⟨hy₁,hy₂⟩⟩ => by
```

@j-loreaux That's what I originally tried, but then in the proof of `LinearMap.polar_AbsConvex`, `Balanced.mulActionHom_preimage` doesn't accept the `B i` argument with the message:
```
application type mismatch
  Balanced.mulActionHom_preimage balanced_closedBall_zero (B i)
argument
  B i
has type
  F →ₗ[𝕜] 𝕜 : Type (max u_3 u_1)
but is expected to have type
  F →ₑ[_root_.id] 𝕜 : Type (max u_3 u_1)
```

Does Lean really need all this information to be supplied manually? It feels like it should be about to figure some of it out itself. 
```suggestion
    ⟨(balanced_closedBall_zero (E := 𝕜) (r := (1 : ℝ))).mulActionHom_preimage (E := F) 
      (𝕜 := 𝕜) (B i), (convex_closedBall _ _).linear_preimage (B i)⟩
```
I think this TODO needs updating
I only put this in to provide motivation for the rest of the PR. Let's save it for #20843.
I don't think that's what you want to do. Are you sure you want these unused section variables as hypotheses?
I've removed this - we can come back to it in #20843

pullRequest.title: feature(Analysis/LocallyConvex/Polar): Show that the polar is weak*-closed and absolutely convex

</details>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Oops - forgot to remove the `WIP` label.
The import increase is unacceptably large. Can you try to find a better place with `#find_home`? Probably something in `Analysis.Normed` is the way to go, but I'm not certain.

> The import increase is unacceptably large. Can you try to find a better place with `#find_home`? Probably something in `Analysis.Normed` is the way to go, but I'm not certain.

`#find_home LinearMap.polar_AbsConvex` and `#find_home! LinearMap.polar_AbsConvex` both say `[Mathlib.Analysis.LocallyConvex.Polar]`.

(N.B. I haven't used `#find_home` before, so perhaps I'm doing something wrong?)
I think that's because in your branch you've edited the `Polar` file to have the necessary imports already.

> I think that's because in your branch you've edited the `Polar` file to have the necessary imports already.

I'm not really getting how this is supposed to work. I removed `LinearMap.polar_AbsConvex` from `Mathlib/Analysis/LocallyConvex/Polar.lean`  and ran `lake build`. Then I created `Mathlib/mwe.lean` as:

```
import Mathlib

variable {𝕜 E F : Type*}

section NormedAlgebra

variable [NormedField 𝕜] [NormedSpace ℝ 𝕜] [AddCommMonoid E] [AddCommMonoid F]
variable [Module 𝕜 E] [Module 𝕜 F]

variable {B : E →ₗ[𝕜] F →ₗ[𝕜] 𝕜} (s : Set E)

variable [Module ℝ F] [IsScalarTower ℝ 𝕜 F] [IsScalarTower ℝ 𝕜 𝕜]

namespace LinearMap

theorem polar_AbsConvex : AbsConvex 𝕜 (B.polar s) := by
  rw [polar_eq_biInter_preimage]
  exact AbsConvex.iInter₂ fun i hi =>
    ⟨Balanced.mulActionHom_preimage (E := F) (balanced_closedBall_zero (E := 𝕜) (r := (1 : ℝ)))
      (𝕜 := 𝕜) (B i), Convex.linear_preimage (convex_closedBall _ _) (B i)⟩

#find_home! polar_AbsConvex

end LinearMap
```

But `#find_home! polar_AbsConvex` just says `[Mathlib]`?
I had another go, copying the lemma into `Mathlib.lean` itself and renaming it. Now `#find_home` says `[Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Module.Dual]`, so I guess that's our answer?

Weirdly `Analysis.LocallyConvex.Polar` is still showing a change?

```
| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.LocallyConvex.Polar | 1308 | 1368 | +60 (+4.59%) |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Module.Dual | 1764 | 1768 | +4 (+0.23%) |
```
I don't understand what's happening here?

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feature(Analysis/Seminorm): Add closedBall equivalents of open ball results
[Merged by Bors] - feature(Analysis/LocallyConvex/Polar): Polar is weak*-closed
